other_tests.findings: The sputum culture contained 150 colonies of normal flora, 50 colonies of Candida albicans, and 1 colony of gram-negative rods, which proved to be Francisella tularensis.

Pleural fluid was yellow, moderately turbid, with a white-cell count of 666, a differential count of neutrophils 31%, lymphocytes 56%, and monocytes 58%. The fluid pH was 8, glucose level was 116 mg/dl, and protein level was 3.6 g/dl.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The chest tube was removed on the fifth hospital day, 24 hours after drainage had stopped.

other_tests.findings: The fiberoptic bronchoscopic examination revealed no purulent material or obstructing lesions. Microscopical examination of bronchoalveolar-lavage fluid showed no neutrophils and no fungi, acid-fast bacilli, or other microorganisms.
The tuberculin skin test was negative.
